snippet: Authorities in Senegal, a Muslim nation that has remained free from violent extremism, fear the groups like Boko Haram are gaining sympathizers.
abstract: Hunt for suspects in Paris terror attacks reaches Senegal, country widely seen as successful example of Islamic democracy; crackdown on anyone suspected of Islamist ties aims to show country upholds moderate, peaceful form of Islam; leaders move to alleviate conditions that have fostered radicalization in other parts of Africa.

byline.contributor: Chérif Faye contributed reporting from Dakar.

lead_paragraph: Authorities in Senegal, a Muslim nation that has remained free from violent extremism, fear the groups like Boko Haram are gaining sympathizers.

headline.main: Senegal, a Peaceful Islamic Democracy, Is Jarred by Fears of Militancy
headline.print_headline: Senegal, Peaceful Islamic Democracy, Is Shaken by Fears of Militancy
